eus_findings:
PANCREAS: The pancreas was visualized from the head to the tail. The parenchyma of the head showed nonspecific hyperechoic foci and strands. The main pancreatic duct in the head measured 2.2 mm, in the neck 1.4 mm, in the body 1.2 mm, and in the tail 0.8 mm. The ducts tapered smoothly with no dilated branch ducts identified. No masses, frictions, or stones were seen.

BILE DUCT: The common bile duct measured 2.9 mm in diameter and appeared normal with no wall abnormalities or stones.

GALLBLADDER: The gallbladder appeared normal with no wall thickening, stones, or pericystic fluid.

LIVER: The liver appeared normal with no focal lesions or abnormalities.

LYMPH NODES: No peripancreatic lymphadenopathy was seen.
egd_findings: EGD not performed. Limited views of the esophagus, stomach and duodenum were normal.
impressions: ['Normal EUS examination of the pancreas, bile duct, gallbladder, and liver', 'No evidence of pancreatic cancer or other abnormalities']

eus_findings:
PANCREAS: A single anechoic oval cyst with a septated component was seen in the body of the pancreas, measuring 9.8 mm in maximum diameter. The cyst communicates with the main pancreatic duct and is likely a branch duct IPMN. The main pancreatic duct was mildly dilated in the neck, measuring 4 mm, and 3.4 mm in the proximal body. The duct was normal in the head, mid body, distal body, and tail. No visibly obstructing lesions or pancreatic masses were seen.

BILE DUCT: The common bile duct was normal, measuring 4.1 mm, with no stones or abnormalities.

GALLBLADDER: There was micro sludge or sludge present in the gallbladder, but no perigallocystic fluid or wall thickening.
egd_findings:
ESOPHAGUS: Fine white exudates were seen in the mid and proximal esophagus, suggestive of Candida infection. The mucosa otherwise appeared normal with no strictures, masses, or nodularities.

STOMACH: The mucosa was variegated, consistent with chronic gastritis. No ulcers, erosions, or masses were seen.

DUODENUM: Erythema and edema were seen in the duodenal bulb and D2.
impressions: ['Branch duct IPMN in the body of the pancreas', 'Mildly dilated main pancreatic duct in the neck', 'Normal EUS examination of the bile duct', 'Sludge in the gallbladder', 'Candida esophagitis', 'Chronic gastritis', 'Normal ampulla, lymph nodes, and celiac axis']

eus_findings:
PANCREAS: Multiple anechoic lesions consistent with pancreatic cysts were seen. The largest cyst was in the proximal body around the neck of the pancreas and measured 1.1 cm x 0.65 cm with a thin septation but no mural nodules or solid components. A fine needle aspiration using a 22 gauge needle was performed. A 4.8 mm x 6.4 mm cyst was seen in the pancreatic head. An 8.6 mm x 9.6 mm cyst was seen in the uncinate process. An 8.7 mm x 5.3 mm cyst with a 1.5 mm septation was seen in the pancreatic head. A cluster of sub-centimeter cysts was seen in the body, the largest measuring 6.2 mm x 3.3 mm. A 7.9 mm cyst was seen in the tail. The main pancreatic duct was normal in diameter, measuring 1.4 mm in the head, under 2 mm in the body, and about 1 mm in the tail. There was no evidence of duct wall thickening, strictures, stones, or mural nodules. There was some amount of myelobularity in atrophy with echogenic foci and stranding.

BILE DUCT: The bile duct appeared normal, measuring 3.1 mm.

GALLBLADDER: The gallbladder appeared normal.
egd_findings: EGD not performed. Limited views of the esophagus, stomach and duodenum were normal.
impressions: ['Multiple pancreatic cysts, largest 1.1 cm x 0.65 cm in the proximal body, s/p FNA', 'Normal EUS examination of the bile duct, gallbladder, and liver', 'Mild pancreatic atrophy with echogenic foci and stranding']

eus_findings:
PANCREAS: A 1.6 cm x 1.4 cm partially circumscribed isoechoic mass with papillary projections was seen obstructing the pancreatic duct at the ampulla with upstream dilation of the duct to 9-12 mm. Fine needle biopsy of the mass at the ampulla was performed using 22 gauge short core needle. A total of 4 passes were obtained with cytotechnologist declaring adequate cellularity.  This was concerning for main duct intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm (IPMN). The pancreatic duct tapers in the body to 4.4 mm and we were unable to visualize the duct in the tail. There was a small 3.5mm x 4.6mm cyst communicating with the pancreatic duct in the body with no concerning features, likely side branch IPMN. There was another intraductal filling defect noted in the upstream duct in the head but this was not biopsied.

BILE DUCT: The common bile duct was normal and measured 4.1-4.6 mm at the ampulla. There was no involvement of the bile duct by the intraductal pancreatic mass.

LIVER: No suspicious lesions or abnormalities.
egd_findings: EGD not performed. Limited views of the esophagus, stomach and duodenum were normal.
impressions: ['Isoechoic intraductal pancreatic mass at the ampulla with marked upstream dilation of the duct, s/p FNB x4. Concern for main duct IPMN', 'Small branch duct IPMN in the body', 'Separate intraductal filling defect in the head, not biopsied', 'Normal EUS examination of the bile duct and liver']

eus_findings:
STOMACH: A 27x14 mm heterogeneous and hypoechoic lesion was seen originating from the muscularis propria with a small 7x7 mm anechoic area within. Fine needle biopsy of the lesion was performed using 22 gauge SharkCore needle. A total of 3 passes were obtained with ROSE confirming adequate cellular yield.

PANCREAS: Appeared normal with no abnormalities or dilation of the main pancreatic duct.

BILE DUCT: The common bile duct was normal, measuring 1.4 mm in diameter with no evidence of stones, wall thickening, or dilation.
egd_findings:
ESOPHAGUS: Normal mucosa.

STOMACH: A 2 cm subepithelial lesion was seen along the greater curvature, anterior wall of the fundus. Bite-on-bite biopsies were performed.

DUODENUM: Normal mucosa without evidence of mass or other abnormalities.
impressions: ['Subepithelial gastric fundus mass, s/p FNB x3. Lesion measures 27x14 mm and is heterogeneous and hypoechoic, originating from the muscularis propria', 'Normal EUS examination of the pancreas and bile duct']

eus_findings:
PANCREAS: The pancreas exhibited diffuse hyperechoic foci and strands with diffuse lobularity, but no discrete masses. The tail appeared fatty with focal fat infiltration. The main pancreatic duct was normal in caliber with no echogenic duct wall thickening, strictures, stones, or mural nodules.

BILE DUCT: The common bile duct appeared normal, measuring 4.5 mm, with no dilation, stones, or wall thickening.

LIVER: The liver appeared normal with no focal lesions or suspicious findings.

LYMPH NODES: No peripancreatic, perigastric, or celiac axis lymph nodes were visualized.
egd_findings:
ESOPHAGUS: The mucosa appeared normal with no erosions, strictures, or masses.

STOMACH: A moderate amount of retained thick liquid with particulate material was seen, despite overnight fasting. The gastric mucosa otherwise appeared normal with no ulcers, nodularities, or visible lesions.

DUODENUM: The mucosa appeared normal with no erythema, villous blunting, or mass lesions.
impressions: ['Normal EUS examination of the pancreas, bile duct, and liver', 'Diffuse pancreatic changes with hyperechoic foci and strands, and lobularity, but no discrete masses', 'Normal gastric and duodenal mucosa with retained gastric secretions']

eus_findings:
PANCREAS: The pancreatic parenchyma showed scattered foci, strands, and myelobularity, but no discrete masses or calcifications. The main pancreatic duct measured 1.2 mm in the head, 0.8 mm in the body, and 0.7 mm in the tail, with a smooth taper and no evidence of echogenic duct wall thickening. Two pancreatic cysts were identified: one in the body measuring 4.2 mm, well-defined, single-chambered, thin-walled, without septations or mural nodules, and no communication with the main pancreatic duct; and one in the neck measuring 4.2 x 3.7 mm, with similar characteristics.

BILE DUCT: The common bile duct was normal in caliber, measuring 2.6 mm, with no strictures, stones, or abnormalities.

GALLBLADDER: The gallbladder appeared normal, with no wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid, or stones.

LIVER: The visualized portion of the liver appeared normal, with no focal lesions or abnormalities.

LYMPH NODES: No peripancreatic, perigastric, or celiac axis lymph nodes were visualized.
egd_findings: EGD not performed. Limited views of the esophagus, stomach and duodenum were normal.
impressions: ['Normal EUS examination of the bile duct, gallbladder, liver, and lymph nodes', 'Two small pancreatic cysts in the body and neck, with no concerning features', 'Normal pancreatic duct with no strictures or stones']
